And that astronomical world record gamma ray burst does not just come from one exploding star, but two merging hyper giant (and possibly wolf Rayet)stars,
And this super(or rather ultra) violent and rare collision can possibly produce up to 600 times more energy than the sun will in its life time,
And there is almost nothing more powerful(and massive) than the collision of two stars like R136a1(the most massive star known, around over 315 times more massive than our own sun), and that is truly mind blowing(literally),
And it’s also likely that this collision not only produces one but two pairs of gamma ray burst, probably because as massive stars collide or come in contact,
It’s possible that one of the stars is already dying (and becoming a black hole),
and the other touching wolf Rayet star could also feed the other dying stars black hole,(which increases the chances of a gamma ray burst, as the black hole feeds on the excess material), and finally the stars will collide and violently explodes.

Gamma ray burst don’t just target planets? They can also target stars!
even though I’m not a scientist but ,I do act like one, but this real life star killer does have an interesting theory ,called the naked star theory?
It’s when a star such as a white dwarf loses its outer layers from an incredibly powerful and violent events such as gamma ray burst, to turn the beautiful white dwarf into a cold dead black dwarf!
And this theory can also be terrifying idea for main sequence stars as well,
and even our own star(also know as the sun) is in the firing line of WR 104(and in case you are wondering what WR stands for, it’s a abbreviation for Wolf Rayet stars(a super rare and strange type of giant star)),
And if our sun does get hit by a gamma ray burst, our sun is most likely going to survive the gamma ray burst,by at a severe sacrifice, and just like planets,
Our own will have also lose it’s outer layers, and our own sun will ether become a white dwarf or a smaller star(such as a orange dwarf),if our sun does get hit by a gamma ray burst,
And when that happens, our own planet(ALSo know as the earth) will also have another (possibly long lasting) ice age,
and that will be another way to die by a gamma ray burst,even if the gamma ray burst does not hit the earth,
but our own sun as the target, will be the other possible outcome by the gamma ray burst.
And weirdly named theory is actually much scarier than you thought?
And a star being hit by a gamma ray burst, will be like a heavy weather closed person being stripped down to a skeleton,
And that’s how terrifying this naked star theory is,
the closer a star is to the source of a gamma ray burst,the more likely that the star will be vaporized (not usually completely vaporized into nothing)into a white dwarf?!
And this is one of the scariest theories that I(Ryan VD) have thought about gamma ray bursts!?

GRBs happen when a black/white hole sucks in an entire star and shoots all it's light directly at us. Think Einstein-Rosen Bridge where the ass end is pointed right at us.

We can't see/detect gamma ray bursts that are not pointed directly at us.

The video does a great job of explaining the inverse square law of light. (The principal holds true for gravity and electromagnetism.)

When a supernova occurs, the light is dispersed in all directions more or less equally. As that light expands outward it gets more and more diluted, as if it were trying to fill up the entire Galaxy.

A gamma ray burst is shot out in a very narrow beam in only one direction. The inverse square law of light doesn't apply. That is why they appear brighter than the entire universe.
